“Rodion Romanovitch, my dear fellow, you’ll drive yourself out of your mind!” 

Porfiry rushed to him, holding a decanter. 

“Come, drink a little. It will do you good.” 

Raskolnikov stared, wild curiosity in his eyes. 

He pushed the glass away. 

“Have some water, do drink a little,” Porfiry insisted. 

“I had an attack,” Raskolnikov replied sharply. 

“Good heavens! You must take care of yourself!” 

“Dmitri Prokofitch was here yesterday,” Porfiry continued. 

“I know why he came,” Raskolnikov said. 

“Why this, Rodion, I know more than that. I know everything.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Porfiry expresses concern for Raskolnikov's health while revealing his awareness of Raskolnikov's situation and the suspicions surrounding him.
